keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The terror group has blurred the line between operations planned and carried out by its core fighters and those carried out by its sympathizers.

headline.print_headline: A Tie to ISIS? Uncertainty as a Strategy
headline.main: Was Orlando Shooter Really Acting for ISIS? For ISIS, It’s All the Same

snippet: The terror group has blurred the line between operations planned and carried out by its core fighters and those carried out by its sympathizers.
abstract: Core of Islamic State's propaganda centers on influencing distant attackers to vow allegiance to militant group and then commit mass murder, as shooter Omar Mateen did in Orlando, Fla, nightclub; strategy, which allows people to carry out attacks without any direct link to organization, is designed to deliberately blur line between planned operations and actions carried out by sympathizers.
